entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is mentioned as being angry and shouting at Dumbledore. He is also referred to as a fool by McGonagall.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as being the target of Fudge's anger and criticism. He is also referred to as swallowing Harry's tales.

entities.name: mcgonagall
entities.description: McGonagall is mentioned as crying out in defense of Cedric Diggory and Mr. Crouch.

entities.name: cedric diggory
entities.description: Cedric Diggory is mentioned by McGonagall as being a victim of the deaths that Fudge dismisses as random.

entities.name: mr. crouch
entities.description: Mr. Crouch is also mentioned by McGonagall as being a victim of the deaths.

relationships.description: McGonagall defends Dumbledore's trust in Harry.
Fudge criticizes Dumbledore for swallowing Harry's tales.
McGonagall defends Cedric Diggory as a victim of the deaths.
McGonagall also defends Mr. Crouch as a victim of the deaths.
